text: this place is by far one of the yummiest and most friendly cafés in Montreal! super cozy, tasty vegan pastries and sandwiches and amazing coffees as well as great & welcoming staff!
Super friendly staff. Delish vegan treats and best latte !!! Cute space! There is even store front parking which is a hard thing to find in Montreal. 10/10

Another amazing gem of a bakery. I went here to just see what they had for vegan treats which he told me everything, absolutely is vegan ! Which I had thought to be amazing.   The parking in the area sucks, I think mostly because it's so busy and I went on a weekday at 1 pm. I had thought that it would've been slower ! But it was worth the headache of finding the perfect free spot in front !   They have many amazing vegan items from tarts, cookies and pizzas. As well as hot and cold drinks. As well they sell really cool pasta and drinks to buy. I grabbed an assorted box of baking as the price was right for $30.00. The price per each baking ranges from $2.00 to $5.00.   They custom make donuts only on Saturday and they post them on their Facebook page what they will be. I have yet to try but they look worth it to checkout. They also have free Wifi which is great if you wanted to work from there. Although I don't suggest it as it is quite nosy and can actually be hard to find seating.   I only give it a 4 as parking and seating is hard. Which gave me a bit of an irritation. But will be back to try the donuts out.

En ce jour de la Saint Jean-Baptiste, le café avait l'air de souffrir de son succès, beaucoup de monde au comptoir et un peu de d'attente de service .. mais franchement, je ne l'ai pas regretté et tant mieux pour le succès!  J'ai goûté une pizzete aux asperges et un calzone (chausson) au kale! Les deux étaient bons, les assortiments de légumes étaient bons mais ce que j'ai plus particulièrement apprécié c'est la pâte! Une vrai bonne pâte à pain qui goûte vraiment bon, un délice.  J'ai fini par un affogato : une boule de glace (végétalienne bien sûr) à la noisette (de chez Lacrem) sur un expresso. Wahou! Le petit boost caféiné-sucré qu'il me fallait.

nice mood, food, friends, future. i, for one, stand approximately eight meters away from all people NOT consuming cookies in order to stay a pure, smart, remote eater. you'll love it and then you will feel empty and sad again. no good thing should make you like yourself and this place definitely hits the mark. i feel like garbage.
A little gem of a cafe with great drinks and pastries. Mint green walls and wooden decor completed with string lights and park views. Heads up - cash only!

Heureuse d'avoir trouvé ce petit café, quoi qu'il soit un peu loin de la maison. J'y suis allée un mardi matin vers 9h et il y avait une petite file d'attente. Pour moi, c'est bien sûr signe qu'il font quelque chose de correct! J'étais en fait en recherche de viennoiseries véganes pour une amie et j'ai pu trouver un choix très intéressant et tout avait l'air absolument délicieux! Mon choix c'est arrêté sur le Cornetto, un petit croissant au chocolat avec zeste d'orange. (Choix facile, les 4 personnes en file devant moi en ont prit!)  Qui l'aurait cru, même sans beurre, ce croissant est probablement un des meilleurs que j'ai mangé de ma vie!   Petit spot très cute et propre, avec un service over sympathique! Faites le détour!

Finally made it out to this chill, lovely cafe and I'm so glad I did. Same care and deliciousness as Le Pick-Up by the same wise crew but a totally unique little love all its own with all vegan pizzas and other amazing moist baked goods that will please even the most unsuspecting dairy fiend. The coffees are excellent Italian style, and there is a nice offering of Italian sodas and bitters and juices as well. Big bright windows look out on a big park and it's a calm neighbourhood, so very nice for working I'd imagine. Can't wait to get back.

A charming spot across the street from a sweet parc. Customers here are well dressed. One looks like an experimental dancer in form-fitting all black. Pony tails are also in evidence. There are subtle differences in the chairs - some black, some like in schoolhouses in the 1950s. I like the tiny grocery and OMG the cookies. Also: Talking Heads on the stereo. The experimental dancer and I are seat-dancing in time to it. A good place!

Just tried their Vegan Latte with homemade almond milk and a vegan cannolli...The Best By Far.  All made in house with love and care.  It is refreshing to find an establishment that caters to a healthier way of life. On a plus also tried their tomato pizzelle, fresh and light just a wonderful delight. Will definitely frequent regularly.

Charmant café situé dans le quartier de Rosemont, le Café Dei Campi offre des viennoiseries (ainsi que quelques plats salés pour le lunch) entièrement vegan. Les seuls items qui ne sont pas adaptés pour les végétaliens sont le lait de vache qui est proposé pour les cafés (en plus, évidemment, du lait d'amande et de soya) et un extra fromage pour les sandwichs. L'intérieur est cozy (quoiqu'un peu petit!) et, surtout, le personnel est très souriant et sympathique: on s'y sent comme chez soi. J'ai aussi eu la chance de goûter à un brunch "exceptionnel" préparé uniquement pendant la période des Fêtes et, à ma grande surprise, ce fut une de mes meilleures expériences de brunch vegan à Montréal. Je croise les doigts pour que le brunch soit offert plus régulièrement! En attendant, Dei Campi demeure un hidden little gem (autant pour les végétaliens que pour les omnivores): ne vous laissez pas refroidir pour la devanture assez discrète et classique. L'ambiance, la bouffe et le café valent le détour!
Great place to go and have a coffee while working. Food is very well done and tasteful.

Life changing coffee. The Iced coffee is made from chilled espresso which gives the drink a rich, dark, and subtle chocolaty flavor. It's thick and creamy and doesn't require anything else but some ice.   Oh and it doesn't hurt that the pastries and other menu items are vegan.

It's been... I don't know how long since a croissant has last passed my lips. There's nothing quite like these delicate pastries, from that first decadent bite to the way the flaky bits melt in your mouth, to the buttery taste that lingers. They are so rarely vegan. In fact, I can't remember ever trying a vegan croissant, though I'd heard rumors that they do in fact exist.  The rumors are true! Vegan croissants exist! The beautiful boomerangs at Café dei Campi will change your life, vegan or not! I can't report to anything about this place other than the orange chocolate croissant that an angel who had surely just recent descended from heaven brought to a breakfast meeting (hi, Mariko!)  I am forever devoted to Café dei Campi for making my flaky, decadent pastry dreams come true (I just peeped another review that says ALL of the pastry here is vegan. PINCH ME!)

Best Latte EVER!!!  My boyfriend and I love coffee and love finding places like this to try out. Since I'm lactose intolerant, I only get filter coffee but just my luck, Dei Campi offers vegan options so they had soy milk and the owner made me the best latte I've ever had. I wish I worked close by so I can go more often. Their food is also really good. Had their lemon biscuit which was amazing.  Vegan or not, you must try this place.

One of the best cappuccino's I've ever had!!!  Everything is made here with absolute care and quality.  I'm not vegan, but I LOVE the food here- everything from the soup to the pastries and salads!!  Definitely a great discovery!!
